page.title: 12North Yorkshire village life
page.content: This is part of a typical day,as described by a young housewife living in Lastingham. "To be awakened by bird song & the ripple of the stream outside is very pleasant. However,the bleeping of the quartz alarm clock or the even louder buzzing of the automatic tea maker are usually required to awake the sleeping household. I,by this time am in the kitchen preparing breakfast,atomatic kettle on,pop-up toaster ready for action. The sliced bacon & tomatoes are under the grill on the electric cooker & the eggs being cracked into the frying pan on top. The remainder of the family are now dressed & assembled round the table eating. The conversation rises & falls around the sounds of radio 2,giving out the days news & weather. Breakfast over,the children then catch the school bus.
